column1: @SpeakerPelosi has delivered on our #ForThePeople agenda at every step. The House passed over 400 bills last year. More than 275 are bipartisan. They're sitting on @senatemajldr's desk. Perhaps you two will go down as the laziest Senate Majority Leader and President in history. https://t.co/G9VtI4FepC
It’s about time Congress exercised its war powers authority under the Constitution. This is long overdue. https://t.co/1x4Xo4HOy7
Tune in to our press conference! https://t.co/a6WpUJ79KY
I believe the Constitution is the soul of our nation and by defending it we are saying we will not be soulless. https://t.co/lY9bJPaLK9

Throughout my service in Congress I've worked to increase research and funding for #PancreaticCancer one of the deadliest of cancers. On #WPCD I renew my support for patients survivors & their families. Thank you @PanCAN advocates for inspiring me & raising hope every day.

REMINDER: It’s Open Enrollment season! It’s time to renew your health insurance coverage for 2020. Free in-person help is available. To sign up call CoveredCA at (800) 300-1506. You can also apply at https://t.co/o9PPNmKygs before Dec 15th for coverage starting on Jan 1st. https://t.co/DR8NL2OMay
I can hear the words of Benjamin Franklin when he emerged from Independence Hall and was asked what they’d produced inside: “A Republic if you can keep it.”

I’m witnessing history today as I listen to the testimony of Ambassador Yovanovitch the daughter of parents who fled the Nazi and Soviet regimes. She has given 33 years in service to the U.S. most recently in Ukraine. https://t.co/LaG0nj7CrF

My Health Subcommittee advanced strong comprehensive legislation today to reverse the youth e-cigarette epidemic and drive down youth tobacco use. We must continue to do everything we can to address the leading cause of preventable death and illness in the U.S. https://t.co/tLGt7stvey

TUNE IN: You can watch the House Intelligence Committee’s first public hearing of the impeachment inquiry. Two senior diplomats from the State Department will present testimony before Members and the American public:  https://t.co/FMcIEPF9aX

We owe so much to our service members and veterans and I hope you’ll take a moment today to bow your head and quietly give thanks to our great patriots for their service and love of country.  https://t.co/xryTwMilCI

As a Member of Congress I strive every day to honor their commitment to the United States by ensuring the health and well-being of the more than 25000 veterans in our Congressional District and the more than 19 million veterans across our country.
On Veterans Day we remember with unending gratitude those who have worn the uniform to defend our country and Constitution. Because of their immense sacrifices we enjoy liberty and freedom.

Bravo @Apple @Google & @Facebook for stepping up to create affordable housing in our region. The public & private sectors must work together to address the housing & homelessness crises and their combined sums of $4.5 billion advance this cause mightily. https://t.co/5KTR072Apz

Proud to introduce the Online Privacy Act w/ @RepZoeLofgren to protect every American's right to privacy. Our legislation ensures you have control over your own data companies are held accountable and the government provides tough but fair oversight. https://t.co/U2GUt9pUz4

I thought of my parents and grandparents yesterday as the House voted to formally recognize the Armenian Genocide. This resolution honors and commemorates my ancestors and all those who perished in the first genocide of the 20th century. https://t.co/YlWssPpOZJ
This resolution not only honors and commemorates my ancestors who perished but all those who were lost in the first genocide of the 20th Century. #ArmenianGenocide

49 U.S. states and over 2 dozen countries including 14 NATO allies have passed Genocide Resolutions. It’s time for Congress to act. There is an historic parallel today as Turkey is once again engaging in ethnic cleansing this time against the Kurds in Syria.
Members of my own family were among those murdered and my parents fled with my grandparents to America. What all of the persecuted had in common was that they were Christians.

Between 1915 and 1923 1.5 million Armenians and hundreds of thousands of Assyrians Greeks Syriacs Arameans Maronites and other Christians were systematically slaughtered at the hands of the Ottoman Empire.
Today the House will vote on a resolution affirming the U.S. record on the Armenian Genocide. I’ve been waiting for this moment since I first came to Congress 27 years ago.

Today October 21st and Tuesday October 22nd I’ll be holding Telephone Town Hall Meetings for my constituents at 6:45 p.m. PDT. Tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to talking with you! https://t.co/JsNupwLdS2

Brava! https://t.co/XD8aKR8UXy

Without direct government negotiation American prescription drug prices have soared. The annual cost of prescription drugs rose 58% over just five years. It’s time to put aside partisanship and pass #HR3 to lower the cost of prescription drugs for every American. #LowerDrugCosts https://t.co/zdXIcZgN4q

Congress can bring down the price of Rx drugs and save billions by passing #HR3. It allows Medicare to negotiate directly with drug companies and extends lower prices for medications to every American. #LowerDrugCosts https://t.co/p6P2lWM80p
... the complexities of the Middle East. More civilian casualties more displacement and an emboldened Russia and ISIS will be the legacy of Donald Trump’s foreign policy. https://t.co/Y55Y4IBHYZ

I’m appalled by the President’s decision to once again put the interests of foreign dictators ahead of U.S. national security and our foreign allies. Allowing Turkey to launch a military offensive in Syria is reckless and further confirms that the President does not understand...

Today the Trump Administration barred Ambassador Gordon Sondland from appearing before investigators in Congress. The White House’s interference is an obstruction of Congress’ impeachment inquiry.
Tune-in to our hearing on #GunViolence as a public health issue https://t.co/lZyBdZamW1

I fully support the Speaker’s announcement of a new impeachment inquiry. The circumstances surrounding the President’s phone call with a foreign leader requires it and we are obligated to go wherever the facts lead. https://t.co/xoEYe7URcM
Congress must obtain the whistleblower complaint to assess if the President asked a foreign power to interfere in our election.
DNI Maguire shall provide Congress with the whistleblower complaint against the President which the Intelligence Community Inspector General has deemed both "urgent" and "credible."

On Thursday September 26th the Acting Director of National Intelligence (DNI) Joseph Maguire will appear before the House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence. What is required of him by law is crystal clear—

Too many Americans are left w/ unaffordable bills for medications they need to survive. House Democrats are moving to rein in out-of-control drug prices for all Americans. I look forward to chairing next week’s hearing to advance the Lower Drug Costs Now Act https://t.co/tyW564XUgl

The Trump Admin’s #PublicCharge rule punishes immigrants who lawfully use Medicaid housing vouchers & food stamps forcing millions of immigrant families to choose b/w their legal status and health. That's why I signed the #TriCaucus amicus brief to oppose this unfair rule.

Tomorrow September 18th and Thursday September 19th I’ll be holding Telephone Town Hall Meetings for my constituents at 6:45 p.m. PDT. Tune in via live webstream to submit your questions. I look forward to talking to you! https://t.co/JsNupwLdS2

both those who were there at the World Trade Center on 9/11 as well as all those who risked their lives in the months of clean-up that followed. Our nation is eternally grateful for their sacrifice.   We must #NeverForget.
Congress passed a permanent reauthorization of the September 11th Victim Compensation Fund Act this July. The law ensures there will be permanent support for all 9/11 heroes and their families –

Eighteen years ago today will remain with us forever when the unimaginable happened and almost 3000 of our fellow Americans died in New York City Washington D.C. and outside of Shanksville Pennsylvania.
We rely on China for pharmaceutical drugs. That’s a security threat. Find out more in my op-ed with @RepAdamSchiff https://t.co/UoY29sHo0I
Good 👏 Riddance 👏 https://t.co/GAX4pyjS6O
This #LaborDay we remember the progress made toward workers’ rights and recommit ourselves to fighting for the safety and dignity of working people. Happy Labor Day to all! https://t.co/8FT1XIcctl

I’ve been a strong advocate of BART’s extension to Silicon Valley for over a decade. The $125 million investment to connect BART with Caltrain in the South Bay will relieve traffic congestion and support the continued growth of our region’s economy. https://t.co/YJKbVFKniC

Thursday August 29th I’m hosting an in-person Town Hall Meeting for my constituents at Smithwick Theatre at Foothill Community College in Los Altos Hills. I look forward to seeing you there! Details below: https://t.co/p6Z9BTFhIP
The courts have consistently upheld the rights of migrants in detention and my hope is that they will overturn the Trump Administration’s inhumane rule. https://t.co/QqkQV7wiuF

After visiting detention centers at the southern border in July it is clear the Trump Administration’s policies have exacerbated the humanitarian crisis. Today’s rule is yet another action to punish refugees.
No family and certainly no child should ever be subjected to indefinite detention and this move by the Administration will create even more suffering.
The Trump Administration’s new rule to detain immigrant families indefinitely flies in the face of 20 years of judicial oversight to protect the human rights and dignity of families.

I applaud Planned Parenthood for their unfailing commitment to provide the best care and medical counsel available to their patients. Unlike the Trump Administration they prioritize patients over politics.

Title X is the only federal grant program dedicated to providing family planning services to low-income and otherwise underserved communities. The Administration’s ill-begotten rules target and will hurt the most vulnerable women in our country.

The Trump Administration is reaping the discord they sow. By forcing a gag rule on health care providers that use #TitleX funding the Administration is robbing nearly 1.5 million women of affordable quality and lifesaving care.
President Trump’s comments encouraging Israel to deny Members of Congress entry into Israel are borne out of ignorance and it’s sad that Prime Minister Netanyahu took the bait.
Fact-finding trips to foreign countries are highly instructive for Members and Israel should use this opportunity to engage in productive dialogue.

Israel’s decision to deny two sitting Members of Congress from entering the country is deeply disappointing and counterproductive to the special bond between the United States and Israel. https://t.co/sWkBcnefaH

Thank you to all who spoke out against the mistreatment of immigrants and refugees on Tisha B’Av. We must continue to speak out and show up for the rights of immigrant families and our neighbors. #TishaBav https://t.co/UoSG2b3XV0
This action and so many others places the Trump Administration on the political endangered list. https://t.co/7o24RilRlU
Preserving the environment has been and continues to be a value of my constituents and I will fight vigorously to retain this value and oppose all assaults on the ESA.

It passed Congress by nearly unanimous support in 1973 and was signed into law by President Nixon a Republican. But today the Trump Administration boastfully announced their intentions to weaken the ESA and continue their relentless assault on the environment.
Bald eagles grizzly bears and American alligators have all been saved from extinction by the landmark law the #EndangeredSpeciesAct (ESA) considered the most successful conservation law in America.
My biggest priority: get Sen. McConnell to #DoSomething. The House passed two bills in February to address gun violence now the Senate must do its job. https://t.co/GyjVrr8xbS
My statement regarding the shootings in El Paso Texas and Dayton Ohio. #EnoughIsEnough https://t.co/SLmQpTrNgi

My statement on the shooting at the #GilroyGarlicFestival: https://t.co/YDcBZK3kkK

I requested w/ 67 Members of Congress that the President demand Sec. of Labor Acosta’s resignation due to his involvement in striking a lenient plea deal in FL over a decade ago with an accused sexual abuser. Today Acosta announced he will step down as Sec. of Labor. Amen. https://t.co/o66CNAnZy8

I wish every constituent a restful and happy Fourth of July.   Happy Birthday America! https://t.co/Kkgvy39ufV

The fight continues today—I voted with #pride last month to pass the Equality Act which amends the Civil Rights Act of 1964 and other existing laws to ensure that LGBT individuals are afforded the same protections against discrimination as every other American. #PrideMonth2019

In 1969 the Stonewall riots took place in Manhattan igniting the Gay Liberation Movement in the United States. They inspired LGBT Pride Month and the call for equality for LGBT Americans. #Stonewall50

Today is #WorldRefugeeDay and I'm proud to support bipartisan legislation introduced by @RepTedLieu @MarioDB @RepJoeNeguse @RepZoeLofgren reaffirming the U.S. commitment to protect refugees and displaced peoples. #StandWithRefugees #WRD2019

On #Juneteenth we commemorate the end of slavery in the U.S. when all remaining slaves in Texas were freed on June 19 1865. As we celebrate these hard-earned freedoms we must remember what we need to do in our day and time to ensure a more equal and inclusive America.

Congratulations to Christine Lee of Saratoga & Edward Jung & Melody Choi of San Jose on being selected for the 2019 National Youth Orchestra. These talented violinists from CA-18 will perform internationally & in the U.S. with the most promising musicians in our country. Bravo!

Our country needs a 21st century commitment to biomedical research and I’m proud to see California receive $4.2 billion from @NIH. The 18th Congressional District is the 2nd highest recipient of NIH grants in California! https://t.co/UDv1aBmM6n

My Health Subcommittee examined proposals today to end surprise medical billing by protecting patients from payment disagreements between providers and insurers. An unplanned visit to the E.R. should never leave insured patients with thousands of dollars in debt.

Surprise medical bills occur when patients are caught between insurers and health care providers and too often it leaves them with exorbitant debts that can wreak havoc on family finances when they learn they were treated by an out-of-network physician.

During #PrideMonth we celebrate the victories and remember the losses on the long march to equality. Three years ago today 49 lives were lost in the #Pulse Nightclub massacre. Take time to remember the victims. My thoughts are with their families today. https://t.co/dgfrj1vBxh

It’s an honor to be part of the Congressional Delegation to Normandy to commemorate the #DDay75thAnniversary. Buried in the Normandy American Cemetery are more than 9300 of our military who gave their lives to protect our democracy and the freedoms we have. https://t.co/y3QarKSt34

Yesterday we passed the #DreamAndPromiseAct in the House to protect Dreamers and refugees seeking asylum in our country. America is the only country most Dreamers have ever known and it’s a worthy fight to give them the chance they deserve to earn citizenship. https://t.co/RsR1Oy74e4

Thirty years ago today protesters supporting Democracy in #TiananmenSquare and elsewhere in China were attacked by their own government. The House passed a resolution today to remember the victims and to call on China to respect the human rights of all people.

I continue to be optimistic about #NetNeutrality  because the majority of Americans—Democrats Republicans & Independents—all support a free and open internet. The House passed a bill to restore net neutrality and now it’s time for the Senate to act. https://t.co/aDOjWnnsNt

Secret decisions and deals in the drug supply chain lead to unaffordable drug prices. Today my Health Subcommittee considered bipartisan legislation to:   1. Stop the deals that drive up costs for consumers and  2. Require drug manufacturers to justify price hikes

Nearly 200 nations signed the Paris Agreement to transition to a low-carbon economy and stop global warming. Trump wants to pull the U.S. out so I voted for #HR9 today to keep our country in the agreement and at the center of energy innovation. #ClimateActionNow

Today we remember the 1.5 million lives lost during the Armenian Genocide. We can never allow time to diminish the cruelty and violence perpetuated by the Ottoman Empire against Armenians Assyrians Greeks and other minorities. We carry the victims' history & honor their legacy

Deeply saddened by the heinous attacks against Christians as they celebrated Easter and tourists in Sri Lanka. My heartfelt condolences to all those affected by this senseless violence.

My heart is heavy as are the hearts of millions around the world to see the 850 year old Cathedral of Notre Dame engulfed in flames. May the people of the world work with the people of France to rebuild it.
